category.name: Shirts
category.title: Men's Shirts
category.description: Newsflash: our edit of men’s shirts means business. When it comes to staple men’s white shirts and men’s black shirts, look no further than ASOS DESIGN for options that’ll take you from office to out-of-office. If the agenda is calling for men’s casual shirts, New Look is your go-to destination for men’s check shirts, plus plain and printed styles to match your mood. For a flex-worthy upper half, set your filters to Polo Ralph Lauren – think signature branding and loadsa different fabrics e.g. flannel, pique and poplin. C’mon, do the smart (or casj) thing.

comments.title: SEE THREW SHIRT WITH BAGGY PIRATE ARMS
comments.content:
The model and video does no justice in showing what I received. And I don’t know how the positive reviews and praise on this item is even valid. This shirt is see threw! And the sleeves are baggy in length. It’s like a pirate shirt. So unless you want ti show off nipples and be Jerry Seinfeld and wear a pirate shirt go for it. To each their own but I would not buy. But a ASOS fitted or H&M regular dress shirt.

comments.title: WOULDN’T ACCEPT A RETURN
comments.content:
ASOS would not accept my return because I had ‘worn’ the item. I had tried the item on for around 30 seconds. If you are not aloud to try clothes on how are you supposed know if they fit as intended. Won’t be using ASOS again which is a shame as I used them frequently.

comments.title: MY GO-TO SHIRT
comments.content:
I love all of these silky pussybow shirts and this is my go-to, easy to pair with literally any outfit I want, instantly classy, easy to breathe in (perfect for the summer but hopefully it'll remain perfect for winter when paired with some cardies, jackets etc.) and ideally androgynous for exactly the vibe I'm looking for! Hopefully we continue to see more shirts in this vain.

comments.content: This was a fabulous option for an unconventional yet dressy shirt and bowtie to wear to prom. I onlywish the scarf/bow was an inch wider.

comments.title: LOOKED MORE LIKE A PRIEST THAN I WANTED
comments.content: I was going for edgy, Johnny Depp, pirate, Dracula vibes, but it came out more minister/priest

comments.title: SIZING CHANGE?
comments.content:
I'm a super short/slim person and fell in love with asos because their 2xs actually fit me. It still isn't the WORST fit. But its so LONG it goes down to my knees and the sleeves are a good several inches too long. This has been the story for the past three 2xs shirts I've bought. Disappointing but not terrible enough for me to stop buying from them.
Read More

comments.title: PERFECT FOR MY SON
comments.content: My son wore it under his suit for homecoming. It was the perfect fit.

comments.title: LOVELY MATERIAL, TERRIBLE STITCHING QUALITY
comments.content:
I’m 5’8” with big shoulders & arms and at 42 don’t have the 6 pack I used to. So only get the size you normally get if you’re extremely trim on the waist & abs. I got a L & XL when I’m usually medium. The L was too tight on shoulders & very tight round the waist. The XL fit on the shoulder & waist but it a weird cut, for me there but the shirt was very very long with really long sleeves. So I got it tailored to fit and I was very happy. Until I washed it and all the stitching came out everywhere except where I had it professionally tailored on the body length & sleeves. It’s a right mess now and cost me another £25 for the tailoring. My advice…. Proceed with caution on ASOS own clothes, the cut is weird & the stitching & build quality are rubbish. Friends have told me this too. Now I have a shirt I’ve spent £50 on I cannot wear.
Read More

comments.title: GREAT SHIRT
comments.content:
I bought this for my son for his prom. It’s a lovely shirt and great quality. The fit is a bit on the large side. My son is medium in other shirts but we could’ve gone for a small for this shirt. Apart from that, it’s a great shirt.
Read More
